author: Heather
text:
From 4 star just a month ago dropping to 3.2 stars?! This is the true story of how a corp  can get so big and forgets who made them. Never, ever, forget your business relies on your customers! Your business does not rely on how big and famous you’ve become!! Your business also does not rely on bullying your customers!!! If you don’t know how to run a business, doesn’t matter how much investment money you got, you’re still bound to fail, and this is exactly where Vestiaire Collective is heading, because this company doesn’t value at all customer’s feedbacks and shows no efforts attempting to improve. Just look at the increasing “1 star” reviews here in the past months, it’s mind blowing! This company is like it’s run by a bunch of spoiled children just received their trust fund money, with that same ungrateful attitude to whom gave you that money. It is absolutely tragic comparing to the start up it used to be, that ethical, open to improvement, customer oriented new company. Please spend your investor money on updating your system, changing your toxic company culture, and getting rid of that rigid and stuck up attitude. You may be a huge company but half the time you’re wrong. 
Let’s see next month how few stars they will have left.
title: When a company forgets about their customers, they bound to fail.

text:

author: Anna
text:
I bought a Chanel suede coat from VC 20/10/2020 in "very good condition". It arrives and is damaged with marks to the skin and dirty -clearly it has not passed through their control system. 

VC then issued a wrong DHL label, which made DHL loose it in their system for over a month. I had to try to rectify their mistake with countless hours on the phone with DHL. The coat was then wrongly sent to an old address of mine in France (I live in the US). Finally, after 2 months, the coat was with them at VC warehouse in France. They then took over a month to process the return.

I payed the coat in USD, using my a credit card in another currency. Because VC only returned the amount to my account 13/1/2021, the dollar had lost its value, and the amount they transferred back to my account was 180 dollars less then what I transferred to them in October 2020. If VC had not 1) lost the coat and then 2) spent months processing their mistake, all this could have been avoided. I've provided them with bank statements and spent literally dozens of hours with customer "service" throughout this whole story, and still they will not return the 180 usd. Absolutely horrible experience. 

Do not shop here, they do not ensure a quality check, and then steal your money/do not own up to their mistake. I've been lied to by people at their customer service (saying they'll get back to me on certain dates, and then not doing so, telling me the processing will be done before Christmas), and only when I threatened to report them to Mastercard for fraud did they return my money partially. 

Such a shame, because I've been a faithful enthusiast of VC for many years. But after this experience I'm never endorsing them again. My tip to anyone would be to save yourselves the high blood pressure, and extremely unsecure customer experience, and spend your time and money elsewhere.
title: How VC stole 180 USD and took 3 months to handle the return of a damaged Chanel coat

author: Meerkat
text:
Buyers, be aware that this website sells fakes, and thanks to the option of direct shipping, VC will not even try to authenticate fake items. Example is 14184318, visibly fake Van Cleef earrings that VC curation team considered eligible for direct shipping in absence of any certificate or invoice or proof of origin and poor photos. The worst part of it all is that VC has re-listed this item already 4 (!!!) times as previous sales have been cancelled. There are over 20 buyers' comments under the item explaining that this item is fake and why it is fake, but VC does not do anything about it.
So be careful with items listed just under below USD/EUR1000 (this is the threshold for direct shipping), if you take the risk with direct shipping, make sure the seller has some sort of history and did not appear just yesterday, and that if something is too good to be true, it is probably best to give it a second thought.
title: Increased number of fake items listed and sold

author: Nicola Marshman
text: I don’t know where to start other than to say the customer service is absolutely awful. I bought an item which was being shipped from France. I paid the import duty to them but when the item arrived in the U.K. the courier invoiced me for it again as the import duty hadn’t been paid this also included a service fee. Trying to get through to this company is almost impossible they only have  a chat function on their app nothing else. I had to wait more than 1 hour before I got through. They told me I would have to sort it out and pay the courier and they would refund me. I said I can refuse delivery as they have not paid the duties but they said I cannot get a refund only resell the item through them on the site 😳 When asked how I get a refund they said they would send an email of the process as I wasn’t keen to pay again as I wasn’t sure whether it’s a scam. The email never arrived I’ve joined the customer service Q at number 54 so probably 2 hours wait this time. I’ve sued similar companies that a lot more customer friendly. I do feel I’m being scammed and not sure I will ever get my refund. I will never ever use this company again.
title: Do not use this company

text:

Why I say deliberately ignoring: there is another issue which I brought up at the same time and they are responding to it as it does not involve potential refund, yet it should. This other-issue is next:

Order Ref : 13409079 (£219.47)

Obviously, I missed the time to give it as a gift, so, I decided to re-list this item in an attempt to get my money back. And guess what? Their ‘curation’ team says it’s not the item ‘they would list on their website’. Yes. I tried to get a reasonable explanation, yet no specific answer was given to why you sell, ‘authenticate’ but don’t accept it for sale.

So, the drama goes on.
I contacted their team in attempt to re-list the item not as new one but as the one which I purchased on their web’ (e.g. their IT team just relocate the item from a seller name to my name). And, their customer team replied (the proof they are selective to what to reply), saying, yes, we can re-list it this way.
So.
I was in touch with 3 different representatives (the current one is Jack) who cannot resolve the issue (the other two just stopped replying/updating me on resolving the issue). The item is visible to their IT team and it’s shown in my ‘submitted’ items but it’s neither among my items for sale nor can be found when searching for this type of items. I repeated the issue all three times with details and multiple screenshots, showing that the item is not listed and not actually visible to buyers. I even had to explain them to log off and go to my items for sale and see it from the buyer’s perspective, this item is not there.

So, all this in my very sad attempt to get my money back and they are not even trying to help anyhow. In both cases.


TO VC TEAM: 
1.	Can you send me a return label for the faulty item (Ref : 13635752), so your team will see it’s certainly not as it was listed/described and refund?
2.	Why your ‘curation’ team does not accept items for sale which were purchased on your website?
3.	Can your ‘curation’ team accept the item to be listed on your website as a new item, not as relisting from a previous seller as it’s obvious that neither your CS team nor IT team know how to do it (which I purchased on your website, Ref : 13409079), so I can try to get my money back?


If this website (trustpilot) allows, I will certainly post an update on those issues.
